column5: Effect
Spend an uninterrupted moment to catch your breath. Can't repeat
column11: If using INT: find a strategic safe spot FAIL: there's something wrong with the spot, if using DEX: avoid attention. FAIL: foe moves to a spot where you're disadvantaged
column12: Find a strategic safe spot / avoid attention. | Recover 1d4 Stamina
column13: Find a strategic safe spot / avoid attention. | Recover 1d4 Stamina
column14: There's something wrong with the spot / Foe moves to a position of advantage. | Recover 1 stamina

column5: As long as you’re not cornered or surrounded, escape your foes. Lose (4-SPEED) Stamina
Just a momentary pause and you're back in the action. When you would normally lose a Stamina Point from physical exhaustion, you can choose to put an exhaustion token on this card instead
column13: Recover 1d4 Stamina. | Your foe moves to a position of advantage.
column14: Recover 1 Stamina. | Your foe moves to a position of advantage.

column5: Once per breather, After successfully striking a foe in melee, add a punch, kick, or shove.
column13: Deal 1 fatigue

column5: When you deal fatigue, you may: Turn x FATIGUE into x HARM
Weapon does not use a EQUIP point. This is your weapon. Your weapon is your best friend. It is your life. You master it as you master your life.
Wear armour for 1 fewer EQUIP points
(Only when you've taken BR since your last Breather) | Enter an enraged state. When dealing damage in melee, flip INT. Add fatigue for every ✗
column11: While Enraged, you are nearly non-verbal.  You cannot make plans with your allies.  Make an INT flip to calm down or wait 60 seconds when combat is over

column5: Consult the spirits that reside within your Signature Weapon, they will give you an insight relating to the current situation, and might ask you some questions in return
column12: The GM will give you good detail
column13: The GM will give you an impression
column14: The GM will give you an impression

column5: When you would normally take physical harm, you can choose to put a harm token on this card instead.
When you would normally lose a Stamina Point from physical exhaustion, you can choose to put an exhaustion token on this card instead
Add magic item’s power to a weapon.  The magic item is destroyed.  Write the power on the weapon card.  The weapon only has 1 charge
add 1 red card on your armour to avoid taking a BR or a WD
+ 1 to Discern Realities during combat
For Parley against a target not significantly bigger than you, flip STR as well as INT.  Take the best

Use your weapon to deal extra damage. Use this instead of "And This Is For...". In melee, flip DEX to deal fatigue again on the same foe.  Any weapon effects happen as well.  After use, flip this card face-down until you next Take A Breather
column13: Deal half your fatigue

column5: Once per breather, Use instead of Scent of Blood. * hit a second target during your attack * deal a wound * disarm your foe | After use, flip this card face-down until you next Take A Breather
column13: Choose 1
column14: Deal 1d4 fatigue to the same  foe

column5: Spend a moment to survey a dangerous area. Spend your green tokens 1-for-1 as you walk through the area to ask these questions: * Is there a trap here and if so, what activates it? * What does the trap do when activated? * What else is hidden here? * How can the trap be disabled?
column12: Place 3 green tokens on this card
column13: Place 2 green tokens on this card
column14: Place 1 green token on this card

column5: Unburden someone of something they're carrying
column13: The GM will offer you two options between suspicion, danger, or cost

column5: A "key" is just a little brass stick with some cleverness carved into it. If you've brought your own cleverness, then you only need a stick.
column13: The GM will offer you two options between suspicion, danger, or cost

column5: Attack a surprised or defenseless enemy with a melee weapon. You can choose to deal your fatigue OR flip DEX. Choices: * You don’t get into melee with them * You deal your fatigue +1d6 * You create an advantage, +1 forward to you or an ally acting on it * Reduce their armor by 1 until they repair it
column13: Choose 1

column5: See a foe from an angle they weren’t expecting and say a weakness you observed, when anyone acts on this info, take +1 forward.
Spend x Stamina to rush an unsuspecting foe. | Choices: * move past them out of their reach * be at their back * deal fatigue to the foe * perform an UNENCUMBERED move
column13: Choose 1
column14: Choose 1 and the foe manages to deal 1 fatigue to you

column5: Nighttime or indoors, while no foe is bearing down on you, regain 1d4 Stamina when Taking a Breather, without needing to flip. Foes cannot see you until you move

When you’re in too deep and need a way out, name your escape route and flip DEX. | On  ✗/✔, you can stay or go, but if you go it costs you: leave something behind or take something with you, the GM will tell you what
column13: see below

column5: Spend one META and describe how the environment or recent events provided a distraction that let you escape the attention of any foes around you

Attack a defenseless or surprised enemy at range. Choose to deal your fatigue or name your target and flip DEX. * Head: choose WD or deal your fatigue (again) * Arms: They drop anything they’re holding * Legs: They’re hobbled and slow moving
column12: Deal your fatigue and choose an option
column13: Choose an option

column5: Put an environmental hazard between you and a foe and goad them to approach
column12: They succumb to the danger and cannot respond to your next action
column13: They succumb to the danger's effects
column14: They see your plan and respond
column15: You succumb to a danger you did not see

column5: While in a pursuit, spend one META and describe one way it is about to change: * we go above * we go below * the air changes * the earth changes * the water changes
When you would lose 1 stamina from mental exhaustion, put 1 EX token on this card instead
Lose 1 charge. * lose 1 charge on all your other magic items * lose all remaining charges on this item * lose a charge on this item permanently
column12: The spell / effect is successfully cast
column13: The spell / effect is cast and choose
column14: The spell / effect is cast, GM chooses
column15: The spell / effect fails.  The GM will say how

column5: Take a WD. Until the WD is healed, using magical items does not cost the usual 1 charge (though charges may be lost via other effects)
Use this before using a magical item.  Instead of the item losing a charge, you might lose Stamina from mental exhaustion
column13: Lose 1 Stamina

column5: Before losing Stamina or taking Harm, end any ongoing magical effect of your magic item.  You can cancel losing 1-3 Stamina points, by losing instead 1-3 charges on the item. To cancel taking a Harm, flip the item card over face-down.
When you Entreat the Blood-Bound, also flip face-up any of your magic items that have been discharged

While you have skin contact with an undepleted magical item, you are attenuated to the universe and have an extra split-second reaction time.  Lose 2 fewer Stamina from physical exhaustion when attacked

Discard this card until you rest. Change a magic item’s effect to that of another item’s that you’ve seen.  New difficulty is set to the other item’s default. | On ✗✗: An effect of the GM's choice is imbued
column13: New effect imbued, but with permanently 1 less charge
column14: New effect imbued, but with permanently 1 less charge
column15: An effect of the GM’s choice is imbued instead

column5: Cast a spell having the effect of a magic item’s effect you’ve seen before.
column13: Lose 2 Stamina, put this card face-down until you rest
column14: Lose 3 Stamina, put this card face-down until you rest

column5: When you attempt to counter a magical effect that will otherwise affect you, stake one magical item on the defense and flip
column12: The spell is countered and has no effect on you
column13: The spell is countered, the item loses a charge
column14: The spell is countered, the item is depleted

column5: Describe a new source (neither the Blood-Bound nor the Living Light) of magical energy in the universe that rushes into your magical item. Use the item, but ignore its limitations or double its effects.  The effects happen no matter what. | On ✗✗: The item is destroyed and you are marked by the new source.
column13: The item is depleted
column14: The item is depleted and you are marked by the new source

column1: Each item takes an Equipment point
column5: The item glows with arcane light, about as bright as a torch. It gives off no heat or sound and requires no fuel, but it is otherwise like a mundane torch. You have complete control of the color of the flame. The spell lasts as long as it is in your presence.

ONGOING. Take an item and set it beside you.  It magically floats in an orbit around your body.  So, carrying this item does not use an Equipment point.  If anything hits the item or comes between you and the item, the spell is immediately dispelled

ONGOING. Make cosmetic changes to items: clean it, soil it, cool it, warm it, flavor it, or change its color. If you cast the spell without touching an item you can instead create minor illusions no  bigger than yourself. Projected illusions are crude and clearly illusions—they won’t fool anyone, but they might entertain them.

Name the spirit you wish to contact (or leave it to the GM). You pull that creature through the planes, just close enough to speak to you. It is bound to answer any one question you ask to the best of its ability.
One of your senses is briefly attuned to magic. The GM will tell you what here is magical.
You form a telepathic bond with a single person you touch, enabling you to converse with that person through your thoughts. You can only have one telepathic bond at a time.
ONGOING. The person (not beast or monster) you touch while casting this spell counts you as a friend until they take fatigue or you prove otherwise.
ONGOING. Touch an ally: nobody can see them. They’re invisible! The spell persists until the target attacks or you dismiss the effect. While the spell is ongoing you can’t use any other magic items.
Hold a pebble or anything less that 10 grams. Send it flying in a straight line at incredible speed.  Target loses 2d4 stamina.  Projectile is destroyed unless it is magical

ONGOING. Walk a wide circle as you flow magical energy into this item. Until you rest again, your magic will alert you if a creature crosses that circle. Even if you are asleep, the spell will shake you from your slumber.
Blow through this item while someone inhales on the other side. 1d4 Stamina returns to them
Spend your resting time meditating over this item while it touches your target. They are healed of 1 harm token or 1 wound token, your choice.
Drop this item on the ground.  It will land pointing towards the direction or course of action the Council of the Living Light would have you take. This item can be powered only by the Living Light

Drip blood from this blade onto a corpse. It converses with you briefly. It will answer any three questions you pose to it to the best of the knowledge it had in life and the knowledge it gained in death. This item can only be powered by the Blood-Bound
At any point when you would take 1 BR, place a BR token on this card and instead lose 1 Stamina
At any point when you would take 1 BR, flip DEX to avoid the BR
column12: Avoid the BR but choose to lose 1 Stamina or the Buckler takes 1 damage
column13: Avoid the BR and lose 1 Stamina
column14: Avoid the BR, lose 1 Stamina, and this item takes 1 damage

column5: Doesn’t take an EQUIP point, does only 1 damage
Spend 1 META and 1 EQUIP and say what equipment you brought along to aid in the current situation. This can also be done as a flashback to re-flip with one level of advantage.

In a steading, spend 2 META and tell a story with the GM about how you found a teacher who helped you level up in one of your skills.  Level up in that skill.  This can also be used to gain new skills

At a steading, the GM will tell you who is selling and hand you 4 cards from the Item deck. To keep one of the cards, you must buy or barter. Choose: * Spend 1 WEALTH * Spend 1 META + 1 EQUIP * Spend 1 META + 1 of your Item Cards
